ol.li: In the Horizon Dashboard, select Compute → Volumes. Locate the volume you wish to detach, and select Manage Attachments from the dropdown menu for that volume.
In the resulting dialog, click Detach Volume. A confirmation dialog box will appear. Click Detach Volume to complete the action.
From the menu, select Compute → Instances. Select the desired instance and confirm that the Overview tab reports that the QNAP volume is no longer attached.

Select the Console tab and log in to your instance. Verify that the instance operating system no longer sees the volume by issuing the following command:sudo fdisk -l
The following screenshot shows sample output for the preceeding command. Your output may vary, depending on existing volumes, operating system, and other factors.
